intro: Pastinaca erzincanensis, commonly known as the Erzincan bur marigold, is a rare flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It has limited distribution and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
